SD Worx-Protime dominate at the UAE Tour Women

It was show time for SD Worx-Protime at the four-stage UAE Tour Women. Lorena Wiebes kicked things off by sprinting to victory on the first two flat stages as Lotte Kopecky won on Stage 3 atop Jebel Hafeet.

It was on this third stage that 21-year-old Neve Bradbury (Canyon-SRAM) shone, attacking from the lead group in the final 3km towards the finish. It was a powerful effort by the Zwift Academy winner but ultimately she was reeled in by World Champion Kopecky, who caught up to Bradbury in the final kilometre, powering ahead in the last 150m to win.

All the breakaway action recently must have rubbed off on Amber Kraak (FDJ Suez), who, on the final stage around Abu Dhabi and on what was expected to be a sprintersâ€™ day, dispatched her breakaway companions to go solo in the last 6km. It was another case of heart-in-mouth breakaway action as the sprinters tried to catch up with the lone rider. Another 100 metres and she would have been absorbed by the mass. Kraak made it to thwart an SD Worx-Protime clean sweep (Wiebes was less than a second behind her), celebrating her first WorldTour win with her FDJ Suez teammates after all made it across the line.
